p: Our results from the anti-mite treatment reveal an effect of the acaricidal activity of the essential oil of Salvia officinalis L. on the parasitic Varroa destructor of the honey bee Apis mellifera intermissa. This acaricidal activity varies with the dose and the period of exposure to treatment. After treatment, we found that the mortality rate presents a better result when using the dose D1: 5% and that corresponds to 21.07%. This result is weak compared to that of Ghomari et al. [ 21], who obtained 48.7.20% of the essential oil of Origanum vulgare, higher than that obtained by Apivar (3.13%), and much better than that of Thymus vulgaris, described as being disappointing according to Giovenazzol et al. [ 22]. Moussaoui et al. [ 23] have shown that the toxicity of the Eucalyptus bioproduct occurs early.
